soc.client

Class GameMessageSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.client.GameMessageSender

  • class GameMessageSender
extends java.lang.Object
    Client class to form outgoing messages and call Connection methods to send them to the server. In-game actions and requests each have their own methods, such as buyDevCard(SOCGame). General messages can be sent using Connection.send(SOCMessage).

    Before v2.0.00, most of these fields and methods were part of the main SOCPlayerClient class.

    Since:
    3.0.00
    Author:
    paulbilnoski

      • buildRequest

        public void buildRequest(SOCGame game,
                         int piece)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        request to build something
        Parameters:
        game - the game
        piece - the type of piece, from SOCPlayingPiece constants, or -1 to request the Special Building Phase.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if piece < -1

      • cancelBuildRequest

      • putPiece

        public void putPiece(SOCGame game,
                     SOCPlayingPiece pp)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        put a piece on the board, using the SOCPutPiece message. If the game is in SOCGame.isDebugFreePlacement() mode, send the SOCDebugFreePlace message instead.
        Parameters:
        game - the game where the action is taking place
        pp - the piece being placed; pp.getCoordinates() and pp.getType() must be >= 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pp.getType() < 0 or pp.getCoordinates() < 0

      • movePieceRequest

        public void movePieceRequest(SOCGame game,
                             int pn,
                             int ptype,
                             int fromCoord,
                             int toCoord)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Ask the server to move this piece to a different coordinate.
        Parameters:
        game - the game where the action is taking place
        pn - The piece's player number
        ptype - The piece type, such as SOCPlayingPiece.SHIP; must be >= 0
        fromCoord - Move the piece from here; must be >= 0
        toCoord - Move the piece to here; must be >= 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if ptype < 0, fromCoord < 0, or toCoord < 0
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • moveRobber

        public void moveRobber(SOCGame game,
                       SOCPlayer pl,
                       int coord)
        the player wants to move the robber or the pirate ship.
        Parameters:
        game - the game
        pl - the player
        coord - hex where the player wants the robber, or negative hex for the pirate ship

      • sendSimpleRequest

        public void sendSimpleRequest(SOCPlayer pl,
                              int reqtype)
        The player wants to send a simple request to the server, such as SOCSimpleRequest.SC_PIRI_FORT_ATTACK to attack their pirate fortress in scenario option _SC_PIRI.

        Using network message request types within the client breaks abstraction, but prevents having a lot of very similar methods for simple requests.

        Parameters:
        pl - the requesting player
        reqtype - the request type as defined in SOCSimpleRequest
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        sendSimpleRequest(SOCPlayer, int, int, int)

      • sendSimpleRequest

        public void sendSimpleRequest(SOCPlayer pl,
                              int reqtype,
                              int value1,
                              int value2)
        The player wants to send a simple request to the server, such as SOCSimpleRequest.SC_PIRI_FORT_ATTACK to attack their pirate fortress in scenario option _SC_PIRI, with optional value1 and value2 parameters.

        Using network message request types within the client breaks abstraction, but prevents having a lot of very similar methods for simple requests.

        Parameters:
        pl - the requesting player
        reqtype - the request type as defined in SOCSimpleRequest
        value1 - First optional detail value, or 0
        value2 - Second optional detail value, or 0
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        sendSimpleRequest(SOCPlayer, int)

      • pickResources

        public void pickResources(SOCGame game,
                          SOCResourceSet rs)
        The user has picked these resources to gain from a gold hex, or in game state GameState.WAITING_FOR_DISCOVERY has picked these 2 free resources from a Discovery/Year of Plenty card.
        Parameters:
        game - the game
        rs - The resources to pick
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • choosePlayer

        public void choosePlayer(SOCGame game,
                         int ch)
        The user chose a player to steal from, or (game state GameState.WAITING_FOR_ROBBER_OR_PIRATE) chose whether to move the robber or the pirate, or (game state GameState.WAITING_FOR_ROB_CLOTH_OR_RESOURCE) chose whether to steal a resource or cloth.
        Parameters:
        game - the game
        ch - the player number, or SOCChoosePlayer.CHOICE_MOVE_ROBBER to move the robber or SOCChoosePlayer.CHOICE_MOVE_PIRATE to move the pirate ship. See SOCChoosePlayer.SOCChoosePlayer(String, int) for meaning of ch for game state WAITING_FOR_ROB_CLOTH_OR_RESOURCE.

      • playInventoryItem

        public void playInventoryItem(SOCGame game,
                              int itype)
        The current user wants to play a special SOCInventoryItem. Send the server a SOCInventoryItemAction(currentPlayerNumber, PLAY, itype, rc=0) message.
        Parameters:
        game - the game
        itype - the special inventory item type picked by player, from SOCInventoryItem.itype

      • pickSpecialItem

        public void pickSpecialItem(SOCGame game,
                            java.lang.String typeKey,
                            int gi,
                            int pi)
        The current user wants to pick a Special Item. Send the server a SOCSetSpecialItem(PICK, typeKey, gi, pi, owner=-1, coord=-1, level=0) message.
        Parameters:
        game - Game
        typeKey - Special item type. Typically a SOCGameOption keyname; see the SOCSpecialItem class javadoc for details.
        gi - Game Item Index, as in SOCGame.getSpecialItem(String, int) or SOCSpecialItem.playerPickItem(String, SOCGame, SOCPlayer, int, int), or -1
        pi - Player Item Index, as in SOCSpecialItem.playerPickItem(String, SOCGame, SOCPlayer, int, int), or -1

      • pickResourceType

        public void pickResourceType(SOCGame game,
                             int res)
        the client player picked a resource type to monopolize.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was monopolyPick.

        Parameters:
        game - the game
        res - the resource type, such as SOCResourceConstants.CLAY or SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP

      • changeFace

        public void changeFace(SOCGame game,
                       int id)
        the user is changing their face image
        Parameters:
        game - the game
        id - the new image id

      • setSeatLock

        public void setSeatLock(SOCGame game,
                        int pn,
                        SOCGame.SeatLockState sl)
        The user is locking or unlocking a seat.
        Parameters:
        game - the game
        pn - the seat number
        sl - new seat lock state; remember that servers older than v2.0.00 won't recognize CLEAR_ON_RESET and should be sent UNLOCKED
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • resetBoardRequest

        public void resetBoardRequest(SOCGame game)
        Player wants to request to reset the board (same players, new game, new layout). Send SOCResetBoardRequest to server; it will either respond with a SOCResetBoardAuth message, or will tell other players to vote yes/no on the request. Before calling, check player.hasAskedBoardReset() and game.getResetVoteActive().
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • resetBoardVote

        public void resetBoardVote(SOCGame game,
                           boolean voteYes)
        Player is responding to a board-reset vote from another player. Send SOCResetBoardRequest to server; it will either respond with a SOCResetBoardAuth message, or will tell other players to vote yes/no on the request.
        Parameters:
        game - Game to vote on
        voteYes - If true, this player votes yes; if false, no
        Since:
        1.1.00

      • considerMove

        public void considerMove(SOCGame game,
                         SOCPlayer robotPlayer,
                         SOCPlayingPiece piece)
        Send a :consider-move command text message to the server asking a robot to show the debug info for a possible move after a move has been made.

        To show debug info before making a move, see considerTarget(SOCGame, SOCPlayer, SOCPlayingPiece).

        Parameters:
        game - the game
        robotPlayer - the robot player; will call getName()
        piece - the piece type and coordinate to consider

      • considerTarget

        public void considerTarget(SOCGame ga,
                           SOCPlayer robotPlayer,
                           SOCPlayingPiece piece)
        Send a :consider-target command text message to the server asking a robot to show the debug info for a possible move before a move has been made.

        To show debug info after making a move, see considerMove(SOCGame, SOCPlayer, SOCPlayingPiece).

        Parameters:
        ga - the game
        robotPlayer - the robot player; will call getName()
        piece - the piece type and coordinate to consider
